data:
1
00:00:44,307 --> 00:00:47,602
People once believed that when someone dies...

2
00:00:47,667 --> 00:00:51,791
a crow carries their soul to the land of the dead.

3
00:00:51,859 --> 00:00:55,088
But sometimes, something so bad happens...

4
00:00:55,154 --> 00:00:58,680
that a terrible sadness is carried with it

5
00:00:58,680 --> 00:01:00,206
and the soul can't rest.

6
00:01:00,275 --> 00:01:03,209
Then sometimes, just sometimes...

7
00:01:03,283 --> 00:01:05,678
the crow can bring that soul back

8
00:01:05,678 --> 00:01:08,073
to put the wrong things right.

9
00:01:49,395 --> 00:01:51,784
Over here.

10
00:01:51,859 --> 00:01:55,688
There's a piece of glass.

11
00:01:55,763 --> 00:01:57,803
Hey, Sarge!

12
00:01:57,875 --> 00:02:00,013
Yeah?

13
00:02:00,082 --> 00:02:02,253
Shelly Webster and Eric Draven.

14
00:02:02,253 --> 00:02:04,425
Wedding was tomorrow night.

15
00:02:04,499 --> 00:02:07,630
Who the fuck gets married on Halloween anyhow?

16
00:02:07,699 --> 00:02:09,554
Nobody.

17
00:02:11,059 --> 00:02:14,855
- Sir, we gotta move her.    - Do it.

18
00:02:14,931 --> 00:02:17,102
All right, guys, let's do it.

19
00:02:17,171 --> 00:02:20,269
Devil's fuckin' Night. What's the count so far?

20
00:02:20,339 --> 00:02:21,648
143 fires.

21
00:02:21,714 --> 00:02:24,431
- They're slacking off from last year. - Three hours to go.

22
00:02:24,499 --> 00:02:29,168
- Maybe they're just slow starters. - Coming through!

23
00:02:32,018 --> 00:02:35,215
You guys can't come in here and take her away like this.

24
00:02:35,283 --> 00:02:39,887
There are procedures. You should have cleared this with me first.

25
00:02:39,954 --> 00:02:42,158
- Is this the victim? - No, it's Amelia Earhart.

26
00:02:42,226 --> 00:02:43,601
We found her, and you missed it.

27
00:02:43,601 --> 00:02:44,976
I don't care what her name is.

28
00:02:45,043 --> 00:02:47,531
I didn't give the order to move her. Jesus, Albrecht.

29
00:02:47,603 --> 00:02:50,919
I can see why they took away your gold shield.

30
00:02:50,995 --> 00:02:53,897
Yeah, I wasn't a big enough asshole. Come on. Let's go.

31
00:02:53,971 --> 00:02:55,826
All right, clear out.

32
00:02:57,139 --> 00:02:59,626
- Shelly? - Stand back, kid.

33
00:03:01,778 --> 00:03:05,804
- Where's Eric? - Just don't worry about him.

34
00:03:05,874 --> 00:03:08,013
Tell him to take care of Sarah.

35
00:03:08,083 --> 00:03:11,858
Look, I will. You just, uh, lie back. Come on.

36
00:03:21,426 --> 00:03:24,176
- You Sarah? - Yeah.

37
00:03:24,243 --> 00:03:28,105
Yeah, look. Your sister, she's gonna be okay.

38
00:03:28,179 --> 00:03:31,310
She's not my sister. Shelly just takes care of me.

39
00:03:31,379 --> 00:03:33,616
She's my friend.

40
00:03:33,683 --> 00:03:37,425
Her and Eric.

41
00:03:37,491 --> 00:03:39,630
You lied to her about Eric.

42
00:03:39,699 --> 00:03:41,226
I had to.

43
00:03:41,299 --> 00:03:44,877
And you're lying to me about Shelly.

44
00:03:44,947 --> 00:03:47,183
She's gonna die, isn't she?

45
00:03:47,250 --> 00:03:51,658
Hey, uh... 

46
00:03:55,859 --> 00:04:01,348
Now, come on. Come on. It's okay.

47
00:04:01,477 --> 00:04:04,738
She's gonna be fine.

48
00:04:22,884 --> 00:04:26,746
A building gets torched. All that is left is ashes.

49
00:04:26,820 --> 00:04:29,602
I used to think that was true about everything...

50
00:04:29,669 --> 00:04:33,891
families, friends, feelings.

51
00:04:33,957 --> 00:04:37,731
But now I know that sometimes, if love proves real...

52
00:04:37,797 --> 00:04:41,987
two people who are meant to be together, nothing can keep them apart.

53
00:05:06,755 --> 00:05:09,602
Later.

54
00:05:18,658 --> 00:05:21,724
What are you, like the night watchman?

55
00:05:42,179 --> 00:05:45,408
You know, what this place needs is a...

56
00:05:45,474 --> 00:05:47,743
good natural catastrophe.

57
00:05:47,810 --> 00:05:52,033
- Earthquake, tornado, you know. - No, no, no, no.

58
00:05:52,098 --> 00:05:54,968
Mickey, come on, man. You got to put the mustard underneath first.

59
00:05:55,042 --> 00:05:57,246
Maybe a flood like in the Bible.

60
00:05:57,314 --> 00:06:00,249
Hey, hey, let me do it.

61
00:06:00,323 --> 00:06:04,185
There we go. All right. How about some onions?

62
00:06:04,259 --> 00:06:06,593
Come on, man. Don't cheap out on me.

63
00:06:06,658 --> 00:06:08,513
- Lots of onions. - All right, here you go.

64
00:06:08,578 --> 00:06:10,880
Hey, all right.

65
00:06:10,946 --> 00:06:13,248
Now we're talkin'.

66
00:06:13,314 --> 00:06:17,853
Hey, it's the Sarah monster.

67
00:06:17,922 --> 00:06:21,599
- How do you steer that on a wet street? - Pure talent. Hi.

68
00:06:21,666 --> 00:06:25,441
Now, Sarah, she's a genuine hot dogger. You hungry?

69
00:06:25,506 --> 00:06:27,230
- You buyin'? - I'm buyin'.

70
00:06:27,299 --> 00:06:30,844
- No onions though, okay? - No onions?

71
00:06:30,914 --> 00:06:34,013
 They make you fart big time...

72
00:06:40,066 --> 00:06:42,685
You know, Lake Erie actually caught on fire once...

73
00:06:42,755 --> 00:06:45,275
from all the crap floating around in it.

74
00:06:46,403 --> 00:06:49,981
I wish I could have seen that.

75
00:07:47,810 --> 00:07:52,120
Fire it up! Yeah!

76
00:08:29,634 --> 00:08:33,409
- All right, we busted their machines! - Shit!

77
00:08:55,426 --> 00:08:58,688
Oh, oh, shit, guys. T-bird, cop car, cop car.

78
00:09:05,634 --> 00:09:08,122
Bad people out on the street tonight.

79
00:09:13,922 --> 00:09:15,777
- Damn it! - What was that?

80
00:09:15,842 --> 00:09:18,395
- You wait right here. - Be careful.

81
00:09:18,466 --> 00:09:21,630
Mickey, call it in for me!

82
00:10:38,946 --> 00:10:41,913
Gabriel!

83
00:10:51,682 --> 00:10:54,649
- Eric?   - Department of Housing!

84
00:10:54,722 --> 00:10:59,065
Code violations? Safety hazards?

85
00:10:59,138 --> 00:11:01,243
Place looks fine to me.

86
00:11:01,314 --> 00:11:03,997
Let's redecorate.

87
00:11:06,434 --> 00:11:10,395
"Abash, the devil stood...

88
00:11:10,466 --> 00:11:13,051
and felt how awful goodness is.

89
00:11:13,122 --> 00:11:17,530
Saw virtue in her shape, how lovely." It's pornography.

90
00:11:18,626 --> 00:11:22,336
Virtue...?

91
00:11:27,138 --> 00:11:30,072
- No! Eric!        - See ya!

92
00:11:30,146 --> 00:11:32,764
No, no, no, me first.

93
00:11:34,722 --> 00:11:36,893
Please.

94
00:11:38,434 --> 00:11:40,889
- Shelly. - Eric!

95
00:12:18,586 --> 00:12:21,400
- Hey, that's good. - That's good.

96
00:12:25,114 --> 00:12:28,561
See if you can top that, man. Can you top that?

97
00:12:28,633 --> 00:12:30,488
Look at that. Look at that.

98
00:12:31,769 --> 00:12:36,025
Here's to Devil's Night, my new favorite holiday.

99
00:12:39,545 --> 00:12:41,455
You go over there and talk to your pals... 

100
00:12:41,530 --> 00:12:44,497
You sick fuck.

101
00:12:44,570 --> 00:12:48,115
Are you out of your motherfuckin' mind, man?

102
00:12:51,225 --> 00:12:55,448
Look at that!

103
00:12:57,529 --> 00:12:59,504
Pussies drink last, man.

104
00:13:00,698 --> 00:13:03,032
- Fuck you, Tin Tin. - Hey.

105
00:13:04,378 --> 00:13:06,799
Shit ain't even loaded, man.

106
00:13:06,874 --> 00:13:08,947
This one is.

107
00:13:09,018 --> 00:13:11,832
Which of you Motor City motherfuckers...

108
00:13:11,898 --> 00:13:16,021
wants to bet me this one isn't?

109
00:13:16,090 --> 00:13:19,832
Hey, fire it up! Fire it up!

110
00:13:19,898 --> 00:13:22,865
- Fire it up! - Fire it up! - Fire it up!

111
00:13:22,938 --> 00:13:25,621
Fire it up! Fire it up!

112
00:13:25,690 --> 00:13:28,657
Here's your shooters.

113
00:13:28,730 --> 00:13:30,639
- Put your guns away, huh, guys? - How ya doin'?

114
00:13:30,714 --> 00:13:34,227
Pussycat.

115
00:14:04,570 --> 00:14:07,919
- I love you. - Say that again.

116
00:14:07,994 --> 00:14:10,165
I love you.

117
00:14:10,234 --> 00:14:13,300
Oh, boy...

118
00:14:13,369 --> 00:14:16,664
Restaurant.

119
00:14:21,113 --> 00:14:24,179
- Wow, you look great. - Ta-da!

120
00:14:27,194 --> 00:14:30,871
Yeah!

121
00:14:30,938 --> 00:14:33,393
- Come here! - No, no, no!

122
00:15:09,178 --> 00:15:12,276
* "Just paint your face" The shadows smile *

123
00:15:13,465 --> 00:15:16,782
* Slipping me away from you *

124
00:15:18,265 --> 00:15:21,681
* It doesn't matter how you hide *

125
00:15:21,754 --> 00:15:24,950
* We find you if we're wanting to *

126
00:15:27,226 --> 00:15:30,903
* So slide back down and close your eyes *

127
00:15:30,970 --> 00:15:34,996
* Sleep a while you must be tired *

128
00:15:35,066 --> 00:15:38,165
* But every night I burn *

129
00:15:38,234 --> 00:15:42,358
* Screaming the animal scream *

130
00:15:44,537 --> 00:15:46,839
* Every night I burn *

131
00:15:46,905 --> 00:15:50,899
* Dreaming the crow-black dream *

132
00:15:55,866 --> 00:15:59,924
* Dreaming the crow-black dream **

133
00:16:07,513 --> 00:16:09,935
Couple more rings. That's 24k.

134
00:16:10,010 --> 00:16:13,872
24k, huh? It's 18k. It's crap. It's probably fake.

135
00:16:13,945 --> 00:16:16,182
Leather purse. Leather.

136
00:16:16,249 --> 00:16:20,592
Geez. Oh, what is this, Tin Tin?

137
00:16:20,665 --> 00:16:25,008
A blood stain that's on here?

138
00:16:25,082 --> 00:16:27,635
I'll give you 50 bucks. And I hate charities.

139
00:16:27,706 --> 00:16:30,423
Now, you, take it or leave it.

140
00:16:30,490 --> 00:16:33,141
Right there for ya.

141
00:16:33,210 --> 00:16:37,400
Decisions, decisions.

142
00:16:38,905 --> 00:16:41,939
- You cheap ass, chrome dome......

143
00:16:42,010 --> 00:16:44,879
child molestin', saprophyte motherfucker.

144
00:16:44,953 --> 00:16:47,222
Close the gate when you go out!

145
00:16:47,289 --> 00:16:49,842
Oh, I close this up for you real good, massa.

146
00:16:49,913 --> 00:16:52,335
- Fuck you....

147
00:16:52,410 --> 00:16:55,705
Yeah, sit on it and twirl, you dirty scum.

148
00:17:00,217 --> 00:17:04,495
Lucky I didn't stab your fat ass.

149
00:17:20,058 --> 00:17:24,466
* Someone take these dreams away *

150
00:17:24,537 --> 00:17:29,109
* That point me to another day *

151
00:17:29,177 --> 00:17:33,684
* Peculiar personalities *

152
00:17:33,754 --> 00:17:37,715
* The stretch of true realities *

153
00:17:40,697 --> 00:17:44,592
* They keep calling me *

154
00:17:44,666 --> 00:17:48,343
* They keep calling me *

155
00:17:49,466 --> 00:17:52,466
* Keep on calling me *

156
00:17:54,714 --> 00:17:57,747
* They keep calling me **

157
00:18:45,209 --> 00:18:48,242
What the fuck you all painted up for, crackhead, huh?

158
00:18:50,713 --> 00:18:54,772
Halloween ain't till manana.

159
00:18:58,009 --> 00:19:00,465
Come on.

160
00:19:35,042 --> 00:19:38,337
Fuck, you murderer!

161
00:19:38,401 --> 00:19:39,677
I ain't murdered nobody, man!

162
00:19:39,677 --> 00:19:40,954
I don't even fucking know you!

163
00:19:41,025 --> 00:19:42,989
Man, what the fuck you want, man?

164
00:19:42,989 --> 00:19:44,953
I want you to tell me a story.

165
00:19:45,025 --> 00:19:48,287
A man and a woman in a loft a year ago.

166
00:19:48,353 --> 00:19:50,808
- You're out of your fucking mind... - Listen!

167
00:19:50,881 --> 00:19:55,551
I'm sure you'll remember. You killed them... on Halloween.

168
00:19:55,617 --> 00:19:57,984
Yeah, yeah, Halloween, yeah.

169
00:19:57,984 --> 00:20:00,352
Some dude, some bitch, whatever, man.

170
00:20:00,417 --> 00:20:02,784
Her name was Shelly...

171
00:20:02,849 --> 00:20:05,719
You cut her. You raped her.

172
00:20:05,793 --> 00:20:11,358
Shelly, yeah, yeah. I shanked her pink ass and she loved it!

173
00:20:20,225 --> 00:20:24,927
Murderer? Murderer? Let me tell you about murder. It's fun!

174
00:20:24,993 --> 00:20:29,434
Lt's easy. You gonna learn all about it.

175
00:20:33,954 --> 00:20:36,409
I'd like you to meet two buddies of mine.

176
00:20:36,482 --> 00:20:39,035
We never miss.

177
00:20:47,105 --> 00:20:49,112
Try harder.

178
00:20:49,185 --> 00:20:51,192
Try again!

179
00:20:56,065 --> 00:21:00,702
Victims. Aren't we all?

180
00:21:11,233 --> 00:21:16,863
* Sometimes it rains inside my head *

181
00:21:16,929 --> 00:21:21,207
* When the words run dry *

182
00:21:21,281 --> 00:21:24,380
* The walls are breathing *

183
00:21:24,449 --> 00:21:28,573
- Look at this mess! What's the world comin' to? - It's a mess.

184
00:21:33,569 --> 00:21:35,577
* No, they don't have to take you *

185
00:21:35,650 --> 00:21:38,300
l got to go upstairs. Report from the front.

186
00:21:38,369 --> 00:21:42,777
* No, they don't have to take you away *

187
00:21:42,849 --> 00:21:46,046
Get out of my way, you worms!

188
00:21:47,105 --> 00:21:48,960
Give me some of that over there!

189
00:21:51,106 --> 00:21:54,651
Why don't you ladies come by later? Check me out.

190
00:21:54,721 --> 00:21:59,293
Hey, guess what? Arcade Games fell down, went boom.

191
00:21:59,361 --> 00:22:03,038
Can you imagine that? It's tragic.

192
00:22:03,105 --> 00:22:07,131
Gather your soldiers. You're on for tomorrow night. No sweat.

193
00:22:07,201 --> 00:22:11,096
- Is the man in? - He's taking a meeting.

194
00:22:39,905 --> 00:22:43,517
You're thinking about the past.

195
00:22:45,730 --> 00:22:48,119
Dad gave me this.

196
00:22:48,193 --> 00:22:52,219
Fifth birthday.

197
00:22:52,289 --> 00:22:56,762
He said childhood's over the moment you know you're gonna die.

198
00:23:10,082 --> 00:23:12,448
Ls she asleep?

199
00:23:18,401 --> 00:23:20,572
I think we broke her.

200
00:23:24,385 --> 00:23:26,457
I love her eyes.

201
00:23:27,457 --> 00:23:29,312
Pretty.

202
00:23:32,993 --> 00:23:38,874
* No, they don't have to take you away **

203
00:23:45,250 --> 00:23:48,283
Hey, kid, get the hell outta the road!

204
00:23:51,201 --> 00:23:55,674
* I don't hate them *

205
00:23:55,745 --> 00:23:59,007
* But I know them *

206
00:23:59,073 --> 00:24:03,481
* I don't want them hangin' 'round *

207
00:24:03,553 --> 00:24:06,041
* I won't roll my bones **

208
00:24:06,113 --> 00:24:11,416
I told you to stay out of here.

209
00:24:11,489 --> 00:24:15,002
So I guess you're not gonna be home till a lot later, huh, Darla?

210
00:24:15,073 --> 00:24:18,935
She's busy. Go play with your dolls or something, okay?

211
00:24:19,009 --> 00:24:21,245
I don't have any dolls.

212
00:24:21,313 --> 00:24:24,542
Get some food, huh?

213
00:24:24,609 --> 00:24:27,479
Somebody already bought me dinner. The police.

214
00:24:32,929 --> 00:24:36,475
"Somebody already bought me dinner. The police."

215
00:24:46,081 --> 00:24:49,180
Thirty, forty dollars.

216
00:24:50,881 --> 00:24:53,216
Who the fuck is this now?

217
00:24:53,281 --> 00:24:57,274
Hey! Piss off! We're closed!

218
00:24:57,345 --> 00:24:59,898
Cerrado!

219
00:24:59,969 --> 00:25:03,646
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead, unless you want to get mutilated.

220
00:25:10,945 --> 00:25:15,036
Goddamn creatures of the night, they never learn.

221
00:25:16,673 --> 00:25:18,331
Hey! Hey!

222
00:25:22,369 --> 00:25:26,559
"Suddenly I heard a tapping, as if someone...

223
00:25:26,625 --> 00:25:30,400
gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door."

224
00:25:32,289 --> 00:25:34,493
What are you talking about?

225
00:25:34,561 --> 00:25:37,179
You heard me rapping, right?

226
00:25:37,249 --> 00:25:41,210
You're trespassing, and you owe me a fuckin' new door!

227
00:25:43,521 --> 00:25:46,391
I'm looking for something in an engagement ring.

228
00:25:46,464 --> 00:25:47,774
Gold.

229
00:25:47,841 --> 00:25:50,077
You're looking for a coroner, shit-for-brains.

230
00:25:54,177 --> 00:25:59,098
Oh, shit. Oh, shit on me!

231
00:25:59,169 --> 00:26:01,590
Shit on me. Shit on me!

232
00:26:07,489 --> 00:26:09,660
Mr. Gideon.

233
00:26:09,729 --> 00:26:11,900
You're not paying attention.

234
00:26:14,689 --> 00:26:16,762
No!

235
00:26:16,833 --> 00:26:21,917
I repeat, a gold engagement ring, yes?

236
00:26:23,489 --> 00:26:26,806
Lt was pawned here a year ago by a customer of yours named Tin Tin.

237
00:26:29,409 --> 00:26:32,922
He confided in me before he ran out of breath.

238
00:26:38,017 --> 00:26:39,926
Who's this sack of shit?

239
00:26:40,001 --> 00:26:42,848
That's Tin Tin, one of T-bird's little helpers.

240
00:26:42,913 --> 00:26:45,847
I think you can rule out accidental death.

241
00:26:45,921 --> 00:26:48,605
Don't any of your street demons have real grown-up names?

242
00:26:48,673 --> 00:26:52,666
This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't look like your usual gang crap.

243
00:26:52,737 --> 00:26:57,276
Come on, Albrecht, spare me. You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

244
00:26:57,345 --> 00:26:59,200
I'm suppose to thank you for that, right?

245
00:26:59,265 --> 00:27:02,877
Watch your fuckin' mouth.

246
00:27:04,033 --> 00:27:06,334
What the hell do you call that?

247
00:27:07,360 --> 00:27:09,848
I call it blood, detective.

248
00:27:09,921 --> 00:27:13,533
I suppose you'll write it up as graffiti.

249
00:27:13,601 --> 00:27:16,252
You can leave my crime scene now, okay?

250
00:27:22,722 --> 00:27:25,505
- Warmer? - What are you doing?

251
00:27:25,571 --> 00:27:28,091
- Don't you know this game? - What game?

252
00:27:28,163 --> 00:27:30,945
Okay, the rings! I'll tell you about the rings!

253
00:27:31,010 --> 00:27:35,233
They're in that metal box! It's under the shelf there!

254
00:27:35,299 --> 00:27:40,602
Take the fucking rings! Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

255
00:27:44,035 --> 00:27:46,523
- Look, it goes to the attic. - Okay.

256
00:27:55,299 --> 00:27:57,241
No, no.

257
00:27:57,315 --> 00:28:00,315
No, no, no.

258
00:28:02,690 --> 00:28:06,749
Oh, it's beautiful. I don't believe it.

259
00:28:10,499 --> 00:28:12,768
Shelly.

260
00:28:20,611 --> 00:28:21,953
I love you.

261
00:28:29,635 --> 00:28:32,449
- You have one chance to live. - Take anything you want.

262
00:28:32,515 --> 00:28:35,482

263
00:28:35,555 --> 00:28:38,304
Now you're going to tell me where to find...

264
00:28:38,371 --> 00:28:40,891
the rest of Tin Tin's little party pals.

265
00:28:40,963 --> 00:28:43,264
The Pit. They all hang out at The Pit.

266
00:28:43,331 --> 00:28:48,219
T-birds's little potato-heads hang out there. Funboy lives there upstairs.

267
00:28:48,291 --> 00:28:51,160
- Funboy. - Oh, baby, oh.

268
00:28:51,235 --> 00:28:54,847
- A whole jolly club... - Please!

269
00:28:54,915 --> 00:28:57,566
- with jolly pirate nicknames! - Stop! Please!

270
00:28:57,635 --> 00:29:00,188
- Jesus Christ in a taxicab! - Hold still!

271
00:29:01,795 --> 00:29:05,057
Each one of these is a life...

272
00:29:05,123 --> 00:29:07,544
a life you helped destroy.

273
00:29:07,618 --> 00:29:10,106
I'm begging you. Don't kill me.

274
00:29:10,179 --> 00:29:13,725
I'm not gonna kill you.

275
00:29:13,795 --> 00:29:17,788
Your job will be to tell the rest of them that death is coming for them...

276
00:29:17,859 --> 00:29:21,242
tonight.

277
00:29:26,083 --> 00:29:30,109
Tell them Eric Draven sends his regards.

278
00:29:31,939 --> 00:29:35,833
You walk outta here, they're gonna erase your sorry ass.

279
00:29:35,906 --> 00:29:39,387
You're nothing but street grease, you motherfucker!

280
00:29:39,458 --> 00:29:41,531
Ls that gasoline I smell?

281
00:29:41,603 --> 00:29:44,418
No, man, no! No!

282
00:29:44,483 --> 00:29:46,458
No!

283
00:29:46,530 --> 00:29:47,807
No!

284
00:30:02,850 --> 00:30:06,167
Lt's on the house, kiddo, you know that.

285
00:30:06,243 --> 00:30:08,414
One root beer.

286
00:30:10,370 --> 00:30:12,988
I can't do anything.

287
00:30:13,058 --> 00:30:17,336
Your mom... technically, she's off right now.

288
00:30:17,411 --> 00:30:19,450
Yeah, way off.

289
00:30:23,874 --> 00:30:28,577
Police! Don't move! I said, "Don't move!"

290
00:30:28,643 --> 00:30:31,545
l thought the police always said, "Freeze!"

291
00:30:31,619 --> 00:30:35,394
l am the police and I say don't move, Snow White. You move, you're dead.

292
00:30:35,459 --> 00:30:40,412
And I say I'm dead and I move.

293
00:30:40,482 --> 00:30:43,646
Not one more step. I'm serious.

294
00:30:43,714 --> 00:30:47,904
Then shoot, if you will, Officer Albrecht.

295
00:30:47,970 --> 00:30:50,970
What are you, nuts? Walking into a gun?

296
00:30:51,042 --> 00:30:52,700
You high?

297
00:30:52,770 --> 00:30:55,836
- You don't remember me? - What are you talking about?

298
00:30:55,906 --> 00:30:59,736
How about Shelly? Do you remember Shelly Webster?

299
00:30:59,811 --> 00:31:02,364
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

300
00:31:02,435 --> 00:31:06,842
I want you to move over to the curb, nice and easy. Move it!

301
00:31:06,914 --> 00:31:11,551
Okay, we're gonna wait here for backup.

302
00:31:11,618 --> 00:31:15,896
- It's gettin' too weird for me. - Oh, it gets better.

303
00:31:15,971 --> 00:31:18,305
Do you know someone named T-bird?

304
00:31:18,371 --> 00:31:22,779
He had a friend who shouldn't have played with knives. Like the coat?

305
00:31:22,851 --> 00:31:25,338
You're the guy that murdered Tin Tin.

306
00:31:25,410 --> 00:31:28,759
- Check it out. - He was already dead.

307
00:31:28,834 --> 00:31:33,984
He died a year ago. The moment he touched her.

308
00:31:34,050 --> 00:31:37,563
They're all dead. They just don't know it yet.

309
00:31:37,634 --> 00:31:39,969
Get away from there!

310
00:31:40,035 --> 00:31:43,035
Cops! Get outta here!

311
00:31:43,107 --> 00:31:46,368

312

313
00:31:55,747 --> 00:31:58,234
Guy shows up looking like a mime from hell...

314

315
00:32:00,611 --> 00:32:06,208
Well, at least he didn't do that walking against the wind shit. I hate that.

316
00:32:06,274 --> 00:32:10,049
Little early for Devil's Night.

317

You are very restless.

318
00:32:14,243 --> 00:32:17,341
Just wish I was a little hungry again, that's all.

319

- Be careful of what you ask for. - Yeah, I may get it, I know.

320
00:32:32,483 --> 00:32:35,385

321

Seeing is believing, isn't it?

322
00:32:48,195 --> 00:32:51,064
Mmm, yummy.

323

324

325
00:33:03,234 --> 00:33:04,925
I didn't have nothing to do with that.

326
00:33:04,994 --> 00:33:07,547

327
00:33:07,618 --> 00:33:10,815
I got trouble. One of my crew got himself perished.

328
00:33:10,883 --> 00:33:13,087
- Yeah, who might that be? - Tin Tin.

329
00:33:13,155 --> 00:33:17,530
Somebody stuck his blades in all his major organs in alphabetical order.

330
00:33:17,603 --> 00:33:20,058
Gentlemen, by all means, I think we ought to have...

331
00:33:20,131 --> 00:33:23,197

332
00:33:25,762 --> 00:33:28,217
You're working for me tomorrow night, right?

333
00:33:28,290 --> 00:33:30,974
- Whatever you say, I can do. - Good.

334
00:33:31,043 --> 00:33:33,726
That's very reassuring.

335

I still ain't heard why Gideon's burned down.

336
00:33:37,730 --> 00:33:42,007
Ls that a natural catastrophe or act of God or something?

337
00:33:42,082 --> 00:33:43,871
Call it my need to know.

338
00:34:16,098 --> 00:34:18,586
Let go, you creep!

339
00:34:21,762 --> 00:34:23,453
Nah....

340
00:34:23,522 --> 00:34:26,686
You didn't even slow down, you dickhead!

341
00:34:28,035 --> 00:34:30,336
He couldn't have stopped.

342
00:34:30,402 --> 00:34:34,526
He was a buttface. I could have made it.

343
00:34:34,594 --> 00:34:37,529
What are you supposed to be, a clown or something?

344
00:34:37,602 --> 00:34:39,511
Sometimes.

345
00:34:41,506 --> 00:34:46,045
Lt's more like surfing than skating. I wish the rain would stop, just once.

346
00:34:47,170 --> 00:34:50,519
- It can't rain all the time. - Eric?

347
00:35:06,768 --> 00:35:11,176
Don't thank me. Are we fighting the good fight?

348
00:35:11,248 --> 00:35:15,404
Double homicide a year ago. No convictions.

349
00:35:15,473 --> 00:35:18,768
Annie... look at that.

350
00:35:18,832 --> 00:35:22,891
"We, the undersigned tenants of 1929 Caulderon Court Apartments... "

351

What is this, a petition?

352
00:35:25,008 --> 00:35:27,758
Big "kick me" sign for a very nice girl who found herself a cause.

353
00:35:27,824 --> 00:35:31,752
- The cause got her killed. - She was fighting tenant eviction in that neighborhood?

354
00:35:31,824 --> 00:35:37,487
Shelly Webster and her nice rock-and-roll boyfriend, Eric Draven.

355
00:35:37,552 --> 00:35:40,968
The last time you snooped around a case is when you got put back on the beat.

356
00:35:41,041 --> 00:35:44,870
- I know. Torres keeps reminding me. - I bet he does.

357
00:35:51,601 --> 00:35:55,179
You're going to wind up working a school crosswalk.

358
00:35:55,249 --> 00:35:57,289
I'm cool.

359
00:35:57,361 --> 00:36:01,900
You didn't get that file from me, okay? And don't tell me you owe me one.

360
00:36:01,969 --> 00:36:04,358
Ah, I owe you one!

361
00:36:04,432 --> 00:36:06,375
Yeah, right.

362
00:36:06,448 --> 00:36:08,521
Damn.

363
00:36:32,912 --> 00:36:36,622
Tomorrow night we can get high...

364
00:36:36,688 --> 00:36:40,233
and watch this whole fucking city burn from that window.

365
00:36:42,960 --> 00:36:45,960
* I am the park ... *

366
00:36:46,032 --> 00:36:49,512
* I am glow *

367
00:36:49,584 --> 00:36:53,479
* ln the motherfuckin' dark *

368
00:36:53,553 --> 00:36:55,625
* I am shocked *

369
00:36:55,696 --> 00:36:57,835
* And I see *

370
00:36:57,904 --> 00:37:00,937
* I don't want to believe *

371
00:37:01,008 --> 00:37:04,008
* No more *

372
00:37:04,080 --> 00:37:06,600
There's a big fuckin' bird over there. 

373
00:37:06,672 --> 00:37:08,560
Huh?

374
00:37:09,680 --> 00:37:12,462
It's a squab...

375
00:37:12,528 --> 00:37:15,049
Come here, bird.

376
00:37:15,120 --> 00:37:17,128
Hey, bird. Hey, bird.

377
00:37:17,201 --> 00:37:19,437
Bird. B-B-Birdie.

378
00:37:19,504 --> 00:37:21,992
Here, birdie, birdie.

379
00:37:22,064 --> 00:37:24,933
Come here, birdie, birdie, birdie.

380
00:37:27,440 --> 00:37:30,539
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

381

Here, Funboy.

382
00:37:35,312 --> 00:37:37,199
What the fuck?

383
00:37:43,344 --> 00:37:47,687
No, man! Don't do that! You nearly gave me a fucking heart attack!

384
00:37:47,760 --> 00:37:49,833
Look at him.

385
00:37:49,904 --> 00:37:52,653
Don't sweat it.

386
00:37:54,289 --> 00:37:57,191
Lt's time for you to take your bird and leave, freako.

387
00:38:04,784 --> 00:38:09,421
Take your shot, Funboy. You got me dead bang.

388
00:38:11,344 --> 00:38:16,079
You are seriously fucked up. Did you look in the mirror?

389
00:38:16,144 --> 00:38:19,527
You need professional help.

390
00:38:21,232 --> 00:38:23,720
Bingo!

391
00:38:23,792 --> 00:38:26,313
He shoots! He scores!

392
00:38:36,048 --> 00:38:39,594
- Jesus Christ! - Jesus Christ?

393

Stop me if you heard this one.

394
00:38:42,352 --> 00:38:45,167
Jesus Christ walks into a hotel.

395
00:38:47,152 --> 00:38:48,875
Ow.

396
00:38:50,352 --> 00:38:53,003
He hands the innkeeper three nails and he asks...

397

Don't you ever fuckin' die?

398
00:38:56,560 --> 00:38:58,699
"Can you put me up for the night?"

399
00:39:03,984 --> 00:39:08,392
- Does that hurt? - Fuck. Does it... Fuck, does it hurt?

400
00:39:08,464 --> 00:39:10,438
Oh, God.

401

Look what you've done to my sheets.

402
00:39:37,680 --> 00:39:39,567

403

You're happy to see me, aren't you?

404
00:40:02,128 --> 00:40:05,837
Stay away! Stay away from me!

405
00:40:13,392 --> 00:40:17,036
Look.

406
00:40:17,104 --> 00:40:21,414
Mother is the name for God on the lips and hearts of all children.

407
00:40:21,488 --> 00:40:26,060

408
00:40:36,044 --> 00:40:40,648

409

410
00:41:12,780 --> 00:41:14,951
Now fill it up!

411
00:41:16,012 --> 00:41:19,241
Fill it up yourself, macho man.

412
00:41:19,308 --> 00:41:21,894

413
00:41:28,173 --> 00:41:30,060
All right.

414
00:41:30,124 --> 00:41:33,899
You burn yourself playing with matches?

415
00:41:33,964 --> 00:41:36,452
- Fuck off. - You have an appointment.

416
00:41:36,524 --> 00:41:38,891
- Well, shit on me. - Drink up.

417
00:41:38,956 --> 00:41:41,771
This is a first. Do I bow or do I curtsy?

418
00:41:41,836 --> 00:41:44,520
Get my friend here a glass of blood.

419
00:41:47,948 --> 00:41:50,730
Hey, good night, Darla.

420
00:41:53,068 --> 00:41:56,614
You stay put right there...

421
00:42:04,364 --> 00:42:07,680
Get away, steamhead.

422
00:42:26,125 --> 00:42:28,012
Shh.

423
00:42:37,549 --> 00:42:43,048
As you can see, I'm on the corner of 27th and Washington...

424
00:42:43,116 --> 00:42:45,734
the site of last year's biggest Devil's Night conflagration.

425
00:42:45,804 --> 00:42:48,674
Lt was exactly one year ago that the building you see...

426
00:42:48,748 --> 00:42:51,563
across the street from me was totally demolished by fire.

427
00:42:51,628 --> 00:42:53,701
The fire that was fought by seven fire companies...

428
00:42:53,773 --> 00:42:55,813
but lost the lives of two fire fighters.

429
00:42:55,885 --> 00:43:00,456
Ln fact, if it weren't for the constant surveillance by the local police... 

430
00:43:00,524 --> 00:43:03,339
Freeze!

431
00:43:03,404 --> 00:43:06,753
Jesus. Don't ever do that, man.

432
00:43:06,828 --> 00:43:08,716
Fuck.

433
00:43:10,604 --> 00:43:12,709
Good likeness.

434
00:43:12,780 --> 00:43:16,326
I saw your body, man. You died. You got buried.

435
00:43:16,397 --> 00:43:18,568
You still have your hat on.

436
00:43:22,317 --> 00:43:24,324
I gotta sit down.

437
00:43:25,100 --> 00:43:26,955
Shi... 

438
00:43:27,020 --> 00:43:29,769
Holy Shit.

439
00:43:31,149 --> 00:43:33,701
Say...

440
00:43:33,772 --> 00:43:37,896
are you some kind of... ghost?

441
00:43:37,964 --> 00:43:39,852
Boo!

442
00:43:47,117 --> 00:43:51,492
I don't know what I am. I need you to tell me what happened to us.

443
00:43:53,420 --> 00:43:57,315
You took a six-story swan dive out of a window.

444
00:43:57,388 --> 00:44:00,355
She, ah, was beaten and raped.

445
00:44:00,428 --> 00:44:04,836
Died at the hospital. Hey, you asked, man.

446
00:44:04,909 --> 00:44:07,429
Come on. Read the file.

447
00:44:07,500 --> 00:44:11,690
Shelly Webster held on for 30 hours in intensive care.

448
00:44:11,756 --> 00:44:14,822
Her body finally just gave it up.

449
00:44:14,892 --> 00:44:18,602
I saw it. I couldn't do jack for her.

450
00:44:28,076 --> 00:44:29,931
- Hey. - Don't touch me!

451
00:44:29,996 --> 00:44:33,826
Hey.

452
00:44:35,180 --> 00:44:37,897
You okay?

453
00:44:37,964 --> 00:44:40,549
I saw her.

454
00:44:42,124 --> 00:44:45,288
I saw her through your eyes.

455
00:44:45,356 --> 00:44:47,363
You stayed with her the whole time.

456
00:44:47,436 --> 00:44:52,674
Yeah, well, you got to understand something, all right?

457
00:44:52,748 --> 00:44:57,288
I was hoping she'd come out of it, you know.

458
00:44:57,357 --> 00:45:00,171
Give me something I could work with.

459
00:45:00,237 --> 00:45:02,375
Yeah.

460
00:45:02,444 --> 00:45:04,779
Look, l... 

461
00:45:04,844 --> 00:45:07,233
Why didn't you do something about it?

462
00:45:07,309 --> 00:45:10,505
You think any people in that building, even the ones who signed the petition...

463
00:45:10,572 --> 00:45:13,889
would talk after what happened to you?

464
00:45:13,964 --> 00:45:17,063
I kept asking questions and...

465
00:45:17,132 --> 00:45:19,685
finally got busted for sticking my nose where it wasn't wanted.

466
00:45:23,533 --> 00:45:25,420
This your wife?

467
00:45:25,484 --> 00:45:29,794
Yeah, we, uh... Well, not anymore, we're getting a divorce.

468
00:45:31,565 --> 00:45:34,412
Lt's funny.

469
00:45:34,476 --> 00:45:38,306
Little things used to mean so much to Shelly.

470
00:45:38,381 --> 00:45:41,729
I used to think they were kind of trivial.

471
00:45:41,804 --> 00:45:44,706
Believe me, nothing is trivial.

472
00:45:53,932 --> 00:45:58,210
You shouldn't smoke these. They'll kill you.

473
00:46:02,700 --> 00:46:05,766
You going to vanish into thin air again?

474
00:46:09,260 --> 00:46:11,845
I thought I'd use your front door.

475
00:46:14,765 --> 00:46:20,362
Look, man, I'm sorry as hell for what happened to you and your girlfriend.

476
00:46:21,837 --> 00:46:24,073
Yeah.

477
00:46:28,428 --> 00:46:30,916
Yeah.

478
00:46:30,988 --> 00:46:34,370
I got stabbed! I shot the son of a bitch!

479
00:46:34,444 --> 00:46:37,444
I watched the bullet hole close by itself.

480
00:46:37,516 --> 00:46:40,451
And then my business gets blown up real good.

481
00:46:40,524 --> 00:46:43,623
- Other than that, my day sucked. - Yeah.

482
00:46:43,692 --> 00:46:46,114
I saw him too. He had a guitar.

483
00:46:46,188 --> 00:46:50,444
He winked at me before he jumped out a fourth-floor window like he had wings.

484
00:46:50,508 --> 00:46:55,330
He winked at ya? Musicians.

485
00:46:55,404 --> 00:46:57,771
- What else did you see? - So far I haven't heard...

486
00:46:57,836 --> 00:47:00,225
shit about what you're going to do about all this crap!

487
00:47:00,300 --> 00:47:05,602
What do I get? My livelihood got flushed and went swirling.

488
00:47:05,676 --> 00:47:08,327
You ain't lost everything.

489
00:47:08,396 --> 00:47:13,284
Yeah, and maybe you're not such a big shot either! Ow! Jesus!

490
00:47:13,356 --> 00:47:16,804
Fair enough. Catch.

491
00:47:17,868 --> 00:47:20,203
Aah! Jesus.

492
00:47:20,268 --> 00:47:22,602
Say hello to the last fellow who wouldn't cooperate with me.

493
00:47:22,668 --> 00:47:24,578
What're you tellin' me, this thing is real?

494
00:47:24,652 --> 00:47:28,165
All the power in the world resides in the eyes, fella.

495
00:47:28,236 --> 00:47:32,033
Sometimes they're more useful than the people who bear them.

496
00:47:32,108 --> 00:47:36,069
You're directly out of your fucking mind! You know that!

497
00:47:36,140 --> 00:47:38,693
Yeah.

498
00:47:38,764 --> 00:47:43,717
Eyes see. It's one of the most important things I learned from my sister.

499
00:47:43,788 --> 00:47:46,920
Sister? She's supposed to be your sister?

500
00:47:46,988 --> 00:47:50,184
My father's daughter. That's right.

501
00:47:50,252 --> 00:47:53,318
What's the matter, you don't see the resemblance?

502
00:47:53,388 --> 00:47:55,560
Now, let's take it from the top, friend.

503
00:47:55,628 --> 00:47:58,980
With a lot of detail. What do you say?

504
00:47:59,107 --> 00:48:02,424
He had a bird with him. Nearly pecked my face off.

505
00:48:02,499 --> 00:48:05,761
He told me to tell T-bird that death was on its way.

506
00:48:05,827 --> 00:48:07,966
Whatever the fuck that means.

507
00:48:08,036 --> 00:48:11,648
Draven. He said his name was Eric Draven.

508
00:48:12,707 --> 00:48:14,682
Want to relax that thing now?

509
00:48:14,756 --> 00:48:19,229
This bird man, he just happened to let you live, huh?

510
00:48:19,300 --> 00:48:23,490
You sure you ain't making all this up just to save your own ass?

511
00:48:23,556 --> 00:48:26,142
I ain't makin' all this up.

512
00:48:26,212 --> 00:48:30,554
I ain't twisted like you two fucks.

513
00:48:32,259 --> 00:48:34,299
All right.

514
00:48:38,756 --> 00:48:43,578
A boy and his bird. Awful touching.

515
00:48:43,652 --> 00:48:47,165
Yeah.

00:48:53,412 --> 00:48:56,281
For fuck's sake, die, will ya? Give me that thing.

517

519

A big one.

520

521

522

You again.

523

524
00:50:22,371 --> 00:50:25,055
Hi....

525
00:50:27,299 --> 00:50:29,154
* It can't rain all the time *

526
00:50:29,219 --> 00:50:33,562
* Can't rain all the time *

527
00:50:42,275 --> 00:50:44,861
l don't know how many times I gotta tell you. We're in this together!

528
00:50:44,931 --> 00:50:47,746
One part falls, it all falls!

529
00:50:47,811 --> 00:50:51,127
- You know how long it took us to put this together? - Yeah, a long time.

530
00:50:51,203 --> 00:50:53,658
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin into a fuckin' voodoo doll!

531
00:50:53,731 --> 00:50:55,738
Tin Tin was a dick.

532
00:50:55,811 --> 00:50:58,681
Tin Tin. Sheesh.

533
00:50:58,755 --> 00:51:02,782
Fire it up! Fire it up! Fire it up! Fire it up!

534

Fire it up!

535

No Funboy.

536

537

Smokes and road beers. Be quick.

538

544

549
00:52:51,236 --> 00:52:55,262

550

551

Oh, look. Makin' us popular.

554
00:53:16,100 --> 00:53:18,969

555

556

557
00:53:27,459 --> 00:53:31,616
Right? Huh?...

558
00:53:33,124 --> 00:53:35,490

559

560
00:53:58,979 --> 00:54:03,071
Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

561
00:54:06,595 --> 00:54:08,962
Shit! Shit!

562

Oh, I hate this. This ain't good.

563
00:54:20,739 --> 00:54:24,055

564
00:54:24,131 --> 00:54:26,433
Shit!...

565

Remember? Yeah, I remember everything.

566

But I don't know what... What? Huh? What?

567
00:54:44,707 --> 00:54:47,358
What are you talkin' about? No, no, no, no, no.

568
00:54:47,427 --> 00:54:50,394

569

570
00:54:52,611 --> 00:54:55,742

571
00:54:55,811 --> 00:54:59,259
And her idiot boyfriend shows up and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

572
00:54:59,331 --> 00:55:02,626
into a total cluster fuck! Who gives a shit?

573
00:55:02,691 --> 00:55:05,822
Lt's ancient history! Why? What do you want?

574
00:55:05,891 --> 00:55:10,594

576

577
00:55:18,819 --> 00:55:21,088

578

579

580
00:55:30,262 --> 00:55:34,058
You can't be you. We put you through the window. There ain't no coming back.

581
00:55:34,134 --> 00:55:37,430
This is the really real world. There ain't no coming back.

582

We killed you dead. There ain't no coming back.

583
00:55:39,830 --> 00:55:44,107
T-bird...

584
00:55:44,182 --> 00:55:47,029
There ain't no coming back! There ain't no coming back!

585
00:55:49,494 --> 00:55:53,488
T-bird....

586
00:55:53,558 --> 00:55:56,787
"Abashed the devil stood...

587
00:55:56,854 --> 00:55:59,669
and felt how awful goodness is."

588
00:55:59,734 --> 00:56:02,516
"And felt how awful goodness is."

589
00:56:15,990 --> 00:56:18,477
T-bird. T-bird.

590
00:57:06,774 --> 00:57:08,978
This is the 7:00 a.m. edition of Action News.

591
00:57:09,046 --> 00:57:11,282
For over a decade, the night before Halloween...

592
00:57:11,350 --> 00:57:15,540
has had a darker and deadlier nickname in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

593
00:57:15,605 --> 00:57:18,901
the name given to what has become an annual plague of arson.

594
00:57:18,966 --> 00:57:24,116
Last year over 200 blazes were reported, and 11 people lost their lives.

595
00:57:24,182 --> 00:57:29,136
Tonight may become the biggest and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

596
00:57:29,206 --> 00:57:32,686
The mayor has firefighters from all surrounding counties... 

597
00:57:32,758 --> 00:57:36,402
Do you like them up or over? I can't remember.

598
00:57:38,358 --> 00:57:40,976
What are you doing? I don't even like eggs.

599
00:57:41,046 --> 00:57:45,781
- Wait, you loved eggs. - Yeah, when I was five.

600
00:57:45,846 --> 00:57:49,807
So what do you want now? Black coffee and cigarettes?

601
00:57:49,878 --> 00:57:53,074
So what did you take to become mother of the year?

602
00:57:53,142 --> 00:57:58,031
Oh, it wasn't drugs. Someone kind of woke me up.

603
00:57:58,101 --> 00:58:03,633
- Who? - Oh, it was nuts.

604
00:58:03,702 --> 00:58:08,721
You're acting weird. Did you win the lottery or something, Darla?

605
00:58:11,126 --> 00:58:15,250
Oh, forget it. I never was too good at this mommy shit.

606
00:58:15,318 --> 00:58:17,423
Over easy.

607
00:58:19,446 --> 00:58:23,952
I like 'em over easy... Mom.

608
00:58:34,102 --> 00:58:36,273
Hey, Albrecht.

609
00:58:38,902 --> 00:58:41,717
This is the third hit in your hood in 24 hours.

610
00:58:41,782 --> 00:58:44,913
We just fished this out of the river. He's fused to his own car.

611
00:58:44,982 --> 00:58:49,041
- We're gonna have to l.D. his teeth. - His name is T-bird.

612

613
00:58:51,030 --> 00:58:52,917
Looks like he zigged when he should have zagged.

614
00:58:52,982 --> 00:58:56,756

615

Come here.

616

617

618

619

620
00:59:13,622 --> 00:59:17,364

621

622

623

624
00:59:25,270 --> 00:59:27,124
and you're saying this is just a fuckin' automobile accident?

625
00:59:27,190 --> 00:59:29,393
- Come on! - Yeah. Good speech though.

626
00:59:29,462 --> 00:59:31,404
I didn't want to interrupt you. It sounded good.

627

You gotta write that shit down.

628
00:59:33,430 --> 00:59:35,285
All right, smart-ass.

629
00:59:35,350 --> 00:59:38,285
The captain's got a little love note waiting for you.

630
00:59:38,358 --> 00:59:42,132
- Welcome to the first day of the rest of your suspension. - Suspension?

631
00:59:42,198 --> 00:59:45,776
- For what? - Misconduct.

632
00:59:45,846 --> 00:59:49,708
Yeah, give me the lab.

633
01:00:38,358 --> 01:00:40,846
One for sorrow, two for joy...

634
01:00:40,918 --> 01:00:43,635
- Come here. - three for a girl, four for a boy.

635
01:00:48,470 --> 01:00:52,115
Dancing...

Eric?

Man, Sarah, you're going crazy.

l thought you were dead.

644

646

648

652

653

654
01:03:18,155 --> 01:03:20,610

655
01:03:20,683 --> 01:03:23,367
And he flash fried T-bird to his fuckin' car!

656
01:03:23,435 --> 01:03:26,817
Aw, T-bird! Here's to you, buddy.

657

658
01:03:31,915 --> 01:03:36,322
- Fire it up! Fire it up! - You see the grave?

659
01:03:36,395 --> 01:03:38,883
Empty. 

660
01:03:38,955 --> 01:03:40,810
Grave? What grave?

661
01:03:40,875 --> 01:03:43,014
What about my fuckin' grave?

662
01:03:43,083 --> 01:03:44,359
Three out of four.

663
01:03:44,427 --> 01:03:47,558
He's working his way back to this speed freak right here.

664
01:03:47,626 --> 01:03:50,179
Lt's not fair. It's Funboy's fault.

665
01:03:50,250 --> 01:03:53,284
That boy was out of control. T-bird, he came in, he says...

666
01:03:53,355 --> 01:03:56,519
"Waste them both." And now this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

667
01:04:00,395 --> 01:04:03,362
This ghost gonna kill my ass next.

668
01:04:03,435 --> 01:04:07,047
This ghost gonna kill... 

669
01:04:07,315 --> 01:04:09,203
That ain't no ghost.

670
01:04:11,027 --> 01:04:14,060
- They have all arrived. - Watch him.

671
01:04:14,131 --> 01:04:16,040
We might need him.

672
01:04:17,491 --> 01:04:19,825
Ghost gonna kill my...

He like his plain or with onions?

674
01:04:35,891 --> 01:04:39,186
Fine. Don't talk to me.

675

When someone's dead, they can't come back, can they?

676

That's what I thought.

677

678

You'll just think I'm nuts.

679

Yeah, well, then maybe they'll have to lock us both up.

680

- You see him too? - I saw somebody.

681

Maybe it was your fairy godfather.

682
01:05:02,931 --> 01:05:05,746
Eric didn't come back for me.

683
01:05:05,811 --> 01:05:10,383
He can't be my friend anymore because I'm alive.

684
01:05:10,451 --> 01:05:13,517

685
01:05:42,770 --> 01:05:45,640
* I am the wicked I am the wave of the future *

686
01:05:58,195 --> 01:06:00,049
* Being crucified *

687
01:06:00,115 --> 01:06:04,238
* You things, things things of the flesh *

688
01:06:04,307 --> 01:06:06,892
* Do it slow *

689
01:06:06,963 --> 01:06:11,087
* Down avenues "cut me" *

01:06:11,155 --> 01:06:14,701

01:06:14,771 --> 01:06:20,783

01:06:20,851 --> 01:06:26,732
* To gaze upon the screen bask on *

01:06:26,803 --> 01:06:28,745
* After the flesh **

Boys.

695
01:06:46,642 --> 01:06:49,938
Lt seems our friend T-bird won't be joining us this evening...

696

697

You wanna sit down?

698
01:06:54,035 --> 01:06:59,185
Well, well, well.

699

Devil's Night is upon us again.

700
01:07:02,258 --> 01:07:04,113
I thought we'd throw a little party...

701

702
01:07:07,379 --> 01:07:09,517
I like the pretty lights.

703
01:07:12,402 --> 01:07:16,144
Problem is, it's all been done before. You see what I'm saying?

704
01:07:16,211 --> 01:07:21,197
- That's no reason to quit. - Wrong. Best reason to quit.

705
01:07:21,267 --> 01:07:23,568
Only reason to quit.

706
01:07:23,634 --> 01:07:28,904
A man has an idea.

707
01:07:28,978 --> 01:07:31,150

708

709

710

711

712

See, that's what's been bothering me, boys.

713
01:07:45,267 --> 01:07:47,950
But I'll tell ya, when I used to think about the idea itself...

714
01:07:48,019 --> 01:07:50,986

715
01:07:51,258 --> 01:07:53,363
You see, gentlemen...

716

717

Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

718

now that's fun!

719

- What about Devil's Night? - What about it?

720
01:08:08,186 --> 01:08:11,448
I started the first fires in this goddamn city.

721

722

723

Devil's Night greeting cards.

724

Lsn't that precious?

725

Yeah.

726

727

728

729
01:08:36,090 --> 01:08:38,479
No.

730
01:08:38,554 --> 01:08:41,042
No, I want you to set a fire so goddamn big...

731
01:08:41,115 --> 01:08:44,082
the gods will notice us again. That's what I'm saying.

732
01:08:44,155 --> 01:08:46,643

733

734
01:08:51,034 --> 01:08:53,041
- Hey, you! What's your name? - Huh?

735
01:08:53,114 --> 01:08:54,969
Skank! You don't feel that?

736
01:08:55,034 --> 01:08:58,198
I feel like a little worm on a big fuckin' hook....

737
01:08:58,266 --> 01:09:00,568
"l feel like a little worm on a big fuckin' hook."

738
01:09:00,634 --> 01:09:04,857

739

How the hell did that thing get in here?

740
01:09:11,087 --> 01:09:13,476
Gentlemen....

741
01:09:13,552 --> 01:09:17,992
Let me go! Let me go! I gotta go!

742
01:09:22,383 --> 01:09:25,995
You're him, huh? The avenger.

743
01:09:26,063 --> 01:09:28,452
The killer of killers.

744
01:09:28,527 --> 01:09:31,244
Nice outfit....

745
01:09:31,311 --> 01:09:33,286
I'm not sure about the face though.

746
01:09:33,360 --> 01:09:35,334
I just want him.

747
01:09:35,407 --> 01:09:38,702
Well, you can't have him.

748
01:09:38,768 --> 01:09:41,321

749
01:09:43,311 --> 01:09:45,678
l see you have made your decision.

750
01:09:47,183 --> 01:09:49,093

751
01:09:49,167 --> 01:09:52,680
Aw, this is already boring the shit out of me. Kill him!

752
01:09:58,320 --> 01:10:02,094
Ooh, that had to hurt.

753
01:10:02,160 --> 01:10:04,843
Well, that's that.

754
01:10:04,911 --> 01:10:07,944
That guy was crazy.

755
01:10:14,319 --> 01:10:16,043
He's gone.

756
01:10:23,759 --> 01:10:25,385
Get him!

757
01:10:41,967 --> 01:10:44,618
Right here! Here, help me! He's gonna kill me!

758
01:10:48,527 --> 01:10:50,437
Jesus Christ!

759
01:11:06,191 --> 01:11:08,078
Hey!

760
01:11:39,247 --> 01:11:41,483
You're all going to die.

761
01:11:55,887 --> 01:11:58,604
Get the fuck outta here!

762
01:12:32,911 --> 01:12:35,726
Guess it's not a good day to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

763
01:12:35,791 --> 01:12:38,890
I'm not Skank. There's Skank right there.

764
01:12:38,959 --> 01:12:42,701
- Skank's dead. - That's right.

765
01:12:42,767 --> 01:12:44,490
No!

766
01:12:48,911 --> 01:12:52,424
What in the crap...

767
01:12:53,711 --> 01:12:56,231
- Don't move! - Hold it!

768
01:12:56,303 --> 01:12:59,598
That's all she wrote! Move and we shoot!

769
01:13:08,335 --> 01:13:11,085
You are surrounded by police units. Do not attempt to escape.

770
01:13:14,383 --> 01:13:17,863
- Stop running immediately. - Holy shit!

771
01:13:17,935 --> 01:13:19,975
arms and legs... 

772
01:13:25,327 --> 01:13:29,899
Stop immediately. Lie down, spread your arms and legs... 

773

Come on! Move it!

774
01:14:17,551 --> 01:14:20,551
Next time duck.

775

So many cops, you'd think they were giving away donuts.

776
01:14:28,111 --> 01:14:31,078
Shit!

777

Oh. I knew you were gonna do that.

778

Look at that out there.

779

The whole city oughta be in flames by now.

780
01:14:42,030 --> 01:14:45,096
Sky oughta be red.

781

So that, I take it, is the late, great Eric Draven.

782
01:14:49,391 --> 01:14:54,858
He has power, but it is power you can take from him.

783
01:14:54,927 --> 01:14:57,774
- I like him already. - The crow...

784

is his link between the land of the living...

785
01:15:02,223 --> 01:15:04,459
and the realm of the dead.

786
01:15:04,527 --> 01:15:08,869
So, kill the crow and destroy the man.

787
01:15:08,943 --> 01:15:10,830
Hmm.

788
01:15:33,007 --> 01:15:34,917
I'm coming home, Shelly.

789
01:16:21,999 --> 01:16:24,333
You're gonna say I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

790
01:16:24,398 --> 01:16:26,373
in the middle of the night, right?

791
01:16:26,447 --> 01:16:28,138
Safest place in the world to be.

792
01:16:28,207 --> 01:16:32,778
Lt's 'cause everybody's dead. I knew you'd come here.

793
01:16:32,847 --> 01:16:36,840
Lt's really late, Sarah.

794
01:16:36,911 --> 01:16:39,560
You didn't say good-bye.

795
01:16:39,687 --> 01:16:43,484
You're just gonna have to forgive me for that.

796
01:16:43,560 --> 01:16:47,619
And you're never coming back.

797
01:16:53,672 --> 01:16:56,771
I gave this to Shelly once.

798
01:17:00,359 --> 01:17:03,174
I think she'd like you to have it.

799
01:17:07,079 --> 01:17:09,251
This way you'll always remember her.

800
01:17:09,320 --> 01:17:11,775
I'll never take it off.

801
01:17:29,192 --> 01:17:32,869
I better go sneak back in the house.

802
01:17:38,728 --> 01:17:40,615
Bye.

803
01:17:59,783 --> 01:18:02,500
Shh! Shh!

804

Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

805
01:18:13,288 --> 01:18:15,655
Come on. Come on.

806

What is that? Some sort of souvenir there from your pal?

807
01:18:33,896 --> 01:18:36,863
I'll just keep it for good luck. What do you say, hmm?

808
01:18:43,048 --> 01:18:46,212
Her eyes are so innocent.

809
01:18:57,096 --> 01:18:58,950
Eric!

810
01:18:59,016 --> 01:19:02,813
Eric, help! Eric!

811
01:19:40,616 --> 01:19:43,715
Quick impression for ya.

812
01:19:43,784 --> 01:19:47,362
Caw! Caw! Bang! Fuck, I'm dead!

813
01:19:47,432 --> 01:19:50,628
Give me the girl and I'll let you walk out of here.

814
01:19:50,696 --> 01:19:53,630
Well, well.

815

Why don't you just give me a minute to think about that, huh?

816

Nah. Fuck it.

817

Aw, fuck.

818

Well, well, well. It does seem to me that our little life has undergone...

819

a rather significant change in the past few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

820
01:20:36,519 --> 01:20:39,781
Well, for a ghost, you bleed just fine.

821

- It's still alive. - Well, then kill it!

822

Bye-bye, birdie.

Ah, shit.

824
01:21:34,375 --> 01:21:36,383
Well, just came by to pay my respects...

825
01:21:36,456 --> 01:21:38,398
and here you are getting all shot up again.

826

- They've taken Sarah. - How many?

827

Two more.

828

829

830
01:21:47,495 --> 01:21:50,146
You stay in front, and when they run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

831

That sounds like a great plan. There's just one problem.

832

833

834

835

836

847

You can have me. I won't fight you.

855

What happened back there with you and your girlfriend...

l cleared that building.

you have put a smile on my face.
